item.title: Rishabh Pant 'Very Excited' Ahead Of Ranji Trophy Return. Report Says 'Virat Kohli Could Join For..... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rishabh Pant 'Very Excited' Ahead Of Ranji Trophy Return. Report Says 'Virat Kohli Could Join For...'

Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Indian cricketer Rishabh Pant is eagerly anticipating his return to the Ranji Trophy, and Virat Kohli may join him for subsequent matches. Pant has expressed excitement over participating in this year's competition for the Delhi team.

  • Pant's kit has arrived at the team's hotel ahead of the upcoming match against Saurashtra starting January 23.
  • He scored 255 runs in the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.
  • Pant is making a landmark return after a severe road accident last year.
  • Virat Kohli's inclusion depends on his availability for matches.
  • BCCI has mandated participation in domestic matches for national team eligibility.
“Participation in Domestic Matches is mandatory for players to remain eligible for selection in the national team and for central contracts.” - BCCI

Rishabh Pant's participation is crucial for Delhi's performance as they strive to improve their ranking in the tournament.

item.title: India Champions Trophy squad: Shreyas Iyer - the crucial piece in middle-order puzzle - The Times of India
item.description:
Shreyas Iyer: Key Middle-Order Player for India's Champions Trophy Squad

Date: January 18, 2024 | Source: Times of India

India's senior selection committee is set to pick the provisional squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy, with Shreyas Iyer being a crucial player for the middle-order.

  • With a stellar performance in the 2023 ODI World Cup, Iyer scored 530 runs in 11 innings.
  • He demonstrated flexibility and resilience, making significant contributions in domestic cricket.
  • Selectors face tough calls regarding the inclusion of players like Axar Patel and Ravindra Jadeja.
“His game is suited for the surfaces in Dubai, with spin expected to play a major role in the tournament.”

Overall, Iyer's performance and adaptability make him a key figure for India as they finalize their squad for the Champions Trophy.

item.title: "Scoring 752 In 7 Innings..." Sachin Tendulkar's Message In Karun Nair Post Is For All To See - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sachin Tendulkar's Praise for Karun Nair's Extraordinary Performances

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Sachin Tendulkar lauded Vidarbha batter Karun Nair amid his remarkable performance in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

  • Karun Nair has scored an impressive 752 runs in 7 innings with an average of 752.00.
  • He has recorded five centuries and one fifty, with his highest score being 163*.
  • Nair's strike rate stands at 125.96, showcasing his aggressive batting style.
  • Sachin Tendulkar emphasized the importance of hard work and focus in achieving such success.
  • Nair led his team Vidarbha to victory in the semifinal against Maharashtra with an unbeaten 88 off 44 balls.
  • If he scores 79 more runs, he will break the tournament's all-time record of 830 runs held by Narayan Jagadeesan.
Scoring 752 runs in 7 innings with 5 centuries is nothing short of extraordinary, @karun126. Performances like these don't just happen, they come from immense focus and hard work. Keep going strong and make every opportunity count!

Sachin Tendulkar's remarks reflect the high expectations and recognition Nair receives in the cricketing world, sparking discussions about his potential return to the Indian national team.

item.title: Marcus Rashford given strict deadline to decide on dream Man Utd transfer exit - The Mirror
item.description:
Marcus Rashford Faces Deadline for Potential Loan to AC Milan

Date: 17 Jan 2025

Source: The Mirror

Marcus Rashford has been given an ultimatum to decide on a loan move to AC Milan by Monday after discussions with the club.

  • Rashford, 27, is expected to leave Manchester United this January.
  • AC Milan is eager to secure Rashford for the upcoming season’s second half.
  • The deadline for the decision has been set for Monday, causing impatience from Milan’s president.
  • Interest in Rashford has also arisen from Barcelona, who are exploring loan options despite their financial troubles.
  • Rashford aims to stay in Europe to improve his chances for England's national team.
“He is a player for Manchester United. We’ll see,” said Ruben Amorim, indicating uncertainty about Rashford's future.

This situation has intensified discussions about Rashford's potential next steps as he considers his career options.

item.title: What Erling Haaland's incredible new 10-year contract means for Man City - and the rest of football: Escaping serious FFP punishment, life after Pep Guardiola and a bitter blow for Galactico-chasing Real Madrid - Goal.com
item.description:
What Erling Haaland's Incredible New 10-Year Contract Means for Man City - and the Rest of Football

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Goal

The Norwegian's historic deal is a statement of confidence from the Cityzens amid Premier League scrutiny and a message to rivals.

  • Erling Haaland has signed the longest contract in football history, a 10-year deal with Manchester City.
  • The contract reflects City's trust in Haaland to lead the team beyond Pep Guardiola's tenure.
  • Haaland has scored 111 goals in 126 appearances for City.
  • This new contract effectively ends Real Madrid's hopes of signing the player.
  • City's sporting director emphasized Haaland's potential to create an incredible legacy at the club.
“I am super proud and happy and I am looking forward to staying here for a long time.” - Erling Haaland

Haaland's commitment to Manchester City is seen as a declaration of confidence in the club's future competitiveness.

item.title: What Erling Haaland's incredible new 10-year contract means for Man City - and the rest of football: Escaping serious FFP punishment, life after Pep Guardiola and a bitter blow for Galactico-chasing Real Madrid - GOAL English
item.description:
What Erling Haaland's Incredible New 10-Year Contract Means for Manchester City and Football

Publication Date: Not specified Source: GOAL

The Norwegian's historic deal is a statement of confidence from the Cityzens in the face of their Premier League hearing and a message to their rivals.

  • Erling Haaland signed a historic 10-year contract with Manchester City, the longest in football history.
  • City shows their commitment to Haaland as a key player for the future, even after Pep Guardiola's departure.
  • Haaland has scored 111 goals for City in 126 games and expressed his pride and happiness in his decision to stay.
  • This contract is a setback for Real Madrid's ambitions to sign Haaland.
“I am super proud and happy and I am looking forward to staying here for a long time.” – Erling Haaland
“The fact he has signed for so long demonstrates our commitment to him as a player.” – Txiki Begiristain

This groundbreaking contract signifies Manchester City's long-term vision and commitment to maintaining competitiveness in football.

item.title: Novak Djokovic shrugs off injury concerns after 'unusual' behaviour - Nine
item.description:
Novak Djokovic Overcomes Abdomen Injury Concern to Defeat Tomas Machac at Australian Open 2025

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Nine News

In a tense match, Novak Djokovic battled both his opponent and physical discomfort to secure a straight-sets victory over Tomas Machac, marking his progression to the fourth round of the Australian Open.

  • Djokovic won the match with a score of 6-1, 6-4, 6-4.
  • This victory is Djokovic's 17th progression to the fourth round at the Australian Open.
  • Djokovic experienced difficulty during the match, reportedly clutching at his abdomen and appearing short of breath.
  • Despite physical struggles, Djokovic expressed satisfaction with his performance, calling it his best match of the tournament.
  • He will face No.24 seed Jiri Lehecka in the next round.
"I was slightly surprised, to be honest, with the result... I just somehow managed to turn things around." – Novak Djokovic

Djokovic's resilience and ability to win under physical stress showcase his enduring prowess in the sport.

item.title: Rohit Sharma to lead India in England ODIs, Champions Trophy; squads announcement on Saturday - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma to Lead India in England ODIs, Champions Trophy

Publication Date: MUMBAI
Source: Times of India

India's senior batsman Rohit Sharma is set to continue as the ODI captain, confirmed by the BCCI ahead of the Champions Trophy and the ODI series against England.

  • Rohit Sharma led India to the final of the 2023 ODI World Cup.
  • A press conference is scheduled for Saturday to announce the teams for the Champions Trophy.
  • Upcoming ODI matches against England on February 6, 9, and 12.
  • Concerns over Rohit's poor form and potential retirement speculations were addressed.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's participation in the Champions Trophy is in doubt due to injury.
  • Discussion on including veteran batsman Karun Nair, who is in exceptional domestic form.
“Whom do you drop if you have to pick Karun in the 15? You can't drop someone like Shreyas Iyer, who smashed a century in the 2023 ODI World Cup semifinal” - BCCI source

As the team prepares for the international fixtures, there are discussions on how to integrate in-form players while maintaining a balanced squad.

item.title: Team India for ICC Champions Trophy to be picked in Mumbai on Saturday - The Times of India
item.description:
Team India for ICC Champions Trophy to be picked in Mumbai on Saturday

Date: This Saturday, Source: Times of India

MUMBAI: The Indian team for the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy in Dubai and Pakistan, starting February 19, will be announced in Mumbai. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar will hold a press conference after revealing the 15-man squad for the tournament.

  • Jasprit Bumrah is unlikely to be part of the squad due to a back injury.
  • India's campaign begins against Bangladesh on Feb 20.
  • Rohit Sharma is expected to continue as captain despite recent poor form.
  • Karun Nair's impressive performances in domestic cricket raises questions about his selection.
“Whom do you drop if you have to pick Kaun in the 15? You can't drop someone like Shreyas Iyer, who smashed a century in the 2023 ODI World Cup semifinal.”

This weekend's squad announcement will be closely watched as it sets the stage for India's participation in the upcoming tournament.

item.title: Man City's dream XI to blast back into title race as FOUR January transfers confirmed - The Mirror
item.description:
Man City's Dream XI to Reignite Title Run with Confirmed Signings

Date: January 2023

Source: Mirror

Manchester City remains off the pace in the Premier League, but several key signings could help them regain their competitive edge.

  • After 21 matches, City sits in sixth place, three points behind fourth and 12 points behind league leaders.
  • Top scorer Erling Haaland has signed a new nine-and-a-half year deal, becoming the highest earner in the league.
  • Injuries to key players like Rodri, John Stones, and Ruben Dias pose challenges for the squad.
  • Potential signings include Abdukodir Khusanov from Lens, Vitor Reis from Palmeiras, Omar Marmoush from Eintracht Frankfurt, and Andrea Cambiaso from Juventus.
Rodri commented, "I know myself, I am a person who recovers well, a person with a positive mentality."

If these signings are completed, they could significantly enhance City's chances of climbing the Premier League table.

item.title: Sydney washout puts Hurricanes, Sixers in Qualifier - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Sydney washout puts Hurricanes, Sixers in Qualifier

Publication Date: Recent Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Wild weather in Sydney has led to a washout that secured the Hobart Hurricanes' top spot in the BBL points table and set up a Qualifier clash against the Sydney Sixers.

  • The Sydney Sixers finished second after the washout.
  • Fans were evacuated due to safety concerns from the roof damage at the SCG.
  • David Warner made a positive start before the game was abandoned.
  • The match featured a significant rain delay, preventing resumption.
  • Hurricanes seek their first title, having finished first just once in 13 BBL seasons.
"It's a position we've been in before where we've had to travel away for a qualifier. I think the group's excited by the opportunity that's going to present to us down in Hobart," - Jordan Silk

Both teams earned one point for the washout, and the Hurricanes will host the Sixers in the grand final qualifier.

item.title: Rinku Singh Gets Engaged To Member Of Parliament? Social Media Abuzz - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rinku Singh Gets Engaged To Member Of Parliament? Social Media Abuzz

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: NDTV

India's star batter Rinku Singh got engaged to Samajwadi Party's Member of Parliament (MP) Priya Saroj, creating a buzz on social media. Fans have been congratulating the couple following the announcement.

  • Rinku Singh is an important member of India's T20I cricket team.
  • Priya Saroj is a Lok Sabha MP from Machhlishahr, Uttar Pradesh, and one of India's youngest MPs.
  • The engagement has been reported by multiple media platforms and journalists.
“Congratulations bhai well done champ” — Aditya Yadav (@AdityaY01164292) January 17, 2025

This engagement comes just before Rinku's upcoming T20I series against England, set to start on January 22.

item.title: Seales takes three as West Indies pin Pakistan down after no play in the morning - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Shakeel, Rizwan fifties lead Pakistan's recovery

Published on: [Insert Date] Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Half-centuries from Saud Shakeel and Mohammad Rizwan helped Pakistan recover from a precarious position against West Indies in the Multan Test.

After a shaky start where Pakistan fell to 46 for 4, Shakeel (56*) and Rizwan (51*) combined for a resilient partnership that brought stability to the innings.

  • West Indies' Jayden Seales showcased his bowling skills, taking 3 wickets for 21 runs.
  • The match faced a four-hour delay due to heavy fog but commenced with Pakistan winning the toss.
  • Shakeel and Rizwan's partnership yielded 97 runs, providing Pakistan with a fighting chance.
  • Pakistan ended the day at 143 for 4, having regained control of the match.
“It was a gritty unbeaten rearguard for the fifth wicket, with Rizwan and Shakeel thwarting the visitors for the rest of the day.”

This day in the Multan Test proved crucial for Pakistan as they looked to recover from early setbacks. The partnership between Rizwan and Shakeel could well set the tone for the rest of the match.

item.title: Dravid, Kumble got upset at missing Ranji; players flew in and reported for state duty: What's stopping Kohli, Rohit? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Concerns over Indian Cricketers Missing Domestic Duty

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Once a duty, now an option, the waning connection between Indian players and domestic cricket is concerning. Players like Dravid and Kumble used to prioritize playing for their states, unlike some current stars.

  • The BCCI mandates players must play domestic cricket when available.
  • Concerns arise as big names rarely return to their roots.
  • Players like Kohli and Sharma have not participated in domestic matches for years.
  • Once, it was common for international players to prioritize state duty.
  • Memorable matches featured legends, showcasing competitive spirit.
“...there was a pride associated with playing for one’s state, and a sense of responsibility...”

The changing culture of Indian cricket calls for a recommitment to domestic play for greater development and connection with roots.

item.title: FIDE chief defends Viswanathan Anand in brutal criticism of Magnus Carlsen: ‘If you want to attack someone…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
FIDE chief defends Viswanathan Anand in brutal criticism of Magnus Carlsen: ‘If you want to attack someone…’

Publication Date: Jan 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

FIDE chief Arkady Dvorkovich has come to the defense of Viswanathan Anand following Magnus Carlsen's critical remarks about FIDE officials during recent tournaments.

  • Carlsen faced criticism for wearing jeans during the Rapid Championship, which led to violations of FIDE's dress code.
  • He accused FIDE officials, including Anand, of being unqualified in their roles.
  • Dvorkovich stated that personal attacks are unacceptable and defended Anand's contributions to FIDE.
  • After the controversy, Carlsen acknowledged that some of his comments were excessive.
  • Match-fixing accusations against Carlsen also surfaced after the Blitz Championship.
“If you want to attack someone, attack me. You can criticise anyone (in FIDE) constructively.” - Arkady Dvorkovich

In summary, Dvorkovich emphasized the importance of respect within the chess community and the need to adhere to established rules while recognizing that mistakes can happen on all sides.

item.title: No-nonsense Novak! Djokovic dominates Machac at Australian Open - ATP Tour
item.description:
Novak Djokovic Dominates Tomas Machac at Australian Open

January 17, 2025 | Source: ATP Tour

Novak Djokovic, despite physical challenges, secured a solid victory over Tomas Machac, advancing to the fourth round of the Australian Open for the 17th time.

  • Djokovic won the match 6-1, 6-4, 6-4 against Machac.
  • This marks Djokovic's 66th Grand Slam round of 16 appearance.
  • He is the second man aged 37 or older to reach this stage since 1988.
  • Djokovic's next opponent will be Jiri Lehecka, another Czech player.
“I think I played really well, honestly. I’m very happy with my game,” said Djokovic.

Djokovic's performance showcases his resilience and skill, setting the stage for a potential quarter-final clash against Carlos Alcaraz.

item.title: Sanju Samson in trouble ahead of ICC Champions Trophy 2025; BCCI to probe India star’s domestic no-show post SMAT - Mint
item.description:
Sanju Samson Faces BCCI Scrutiny for Missing Domestic Matches Ahead of ICC Champions Trophy 2025

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Live Mint

Indian cricketer Sanju Samson finds himself in trouble as he skipped domestic matches crucial for eligibility ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. This non-participation raises questions about his selection for the national team.

  • Samson has not played since December 2024 during the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.
  • BCCI mandates all players to participate in domestic cricket when not on national duty.
  • Reports indicate that BCCI officials are dissatisfied with his absence from the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy.
  • Samson was spotted at Rajasthan Royals' practice but has been on holiday in the UAE.
  • His chances for selection for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 are uncertain.
  • Other teammates previously faced consequences for similar absences.
“Don’t be surprised if Samson too encounters the same fate.”

As the BCCI evaluates its upcoming squads, Sanju Samson's future participation in major tournaments hangs in the balance.

item.title: Man Utd REJECT Napoli's opening offer for Alejandro Garnacho - with Antonio Conte's side unwilling to meet Red Devils' price tag - GOAL English
item.description:
Man Utd REJECT Napoli's opening offer for Alejandro Garnacho

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Goal.com

Manchester United has turned down an initial bid from Napoli for Alejandro Garnacho, as the Italian club is not meeting the Red Devils' asking price.

  • Manchester United has received an opening offer from Napoli for Alejandro Garnacho.
  • The offer has been rejected as it does not meet United's price tag.
  • Antonio Conte's side is reportedly unwilling to match the amount set by United.
"Garnacho is considered a key asset for United and they are not planning to sell him without a significant offer."

This situation highlights the ongoing transfer battles in the summer window, where clubs are trying to negotiate the best deals for their players.

item.title: Delhi High Court restrains unauthorised use of cricketer Shikhar Dhawan's image - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Delhi High Court Stops Unauthorized Use of Shikhar Dhawan's Image

Published on: 17 Jan 2025, 10:17 am

The Delhi High Court has issued an interim order restraining DB Dixon Battery from using Indian cricketer Shikhar Dhawan's image on its products and advertisements due to a dispute over an endorsement agreement.

  • The agreement permitted DB Dixon Battery to use Dhawan's image for marketing.
  • Dhawan claims the company violated agreement terms, leading him to terminate the contract.
  • The High Court has temporarily prohibited the company from using Dhawan's images until the next hearing.
“Dixon is still selling products in my name as if they are being endorsed by me,” Advocate Rizwan argued.

The case will be further heard on February 18, 2025.

item.title: Gambhir told to stop ‘blame game’; even Kohli, Rohit could be among 'targets': 'There was no Sarfaraz in BCCI meeting' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gambhir Urged to End Blame Game Amid Criticism Over Team Leaks

Published on: January 17, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Amid a turbulent season for Indian cricket, former Pakistan batter Basit Ali has called on Gautam Gambhir to take responsibility and help stop the blame game following leaks from the team's dressing room.

  • Concern over leaked comments from head coach Gautam Gambhir following India's poor performance in the 2024/25 season.
  • Basit Ali emphasizes the need for unity in the team as they prepare for the Champions Trophy.
  • Criticism directed towards Sarfaraz Khan over alleged leaking of team information, impacting team morale.
  • Ali suggests that key figures in BCCI must work together to ensure a positive team environment.
“Such news are spread to affect the team environment,” Basit Ali stated on his Youtube channel.

As the Indian team gears up for the Champions Trophy, the focus remains on resolving internal conflicts to build team confidence ahead of crucial matches.

item.title: Aitana Bonmati to Alexia Putellas: Women footballers who earn crores every year - India.com
item.description:
Aitana Bonmati to Alexia Putellas: Women Footballers Who Earn Crores Every Year

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: india.com

Women's football has experienced remarkable growth in recent years, with elite players excelling on the field and earning substantial incomes off it. Athletes like Aitana Bonmatí, known for her midfield skills, and Alexia Putellas, celebrated for her unique style, have emerged as global figures, challenging norms and transforming the financial aspects of the sport.

  • Aitana Bonmatí is the highest-paid female footballer, earning approximately Rs 87 crore in the past year.
  • Sam Kerr ranks third in earnings, making Rs 47 crore annually.
  • Keria Walsh earns about Rs 40 crore annually.
  • Ada Hegerberg ranks among the top five earners, earning 35 crores per year.
  • Marta, from Brazil, has an annual income of approximately 33 crores.
  • Wendy Renard from France brings in around 31 crores each year.
"This collection of pictures highlights female footballers who earn millions annually, demonstrating that skill and commitment can lead to a profitable career in the sport."

This surge in earnings reflects the increasing recognition and commercialization of women's football, indicating a promising future for female athletes in sports.

item.title: Women's Under-19 World Cup: five players to keep a close eye on - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Women's Under-19 World Cup: Five Players to Keep a Close Eye On

Publication Date: Unspecified | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

The upcoming 2025 Women's Under-19 World Cup in Malaysia is set to showcase several young talents. Here are five players who have already made headlines in the cricketing world.

  • Caoimhe Bray (Australia): A seam-bowling allrounder who gained attention after becoming the youngest player in the WBBL at age 15.
  • Tilly Corteen-Coleman (England): A left-arm spinner known for impressive performances in domestic cricket, including dismissing Meg Lanning.
  • Niki Prasad (India): A powerful hitter and captain for India, looking to defend their championship title.
  • Karabo Meso (South Africa): The rising wicketkeeper with a strong family sporting background, making her second World Cup appearance.
  • Limansa Thilakarathna (Sri Lanka): A young legspinner and daughter of former captain Tillakaratne Dilshan with goals of making a mark in cricket.

item.title: ICC Champions Trophy 2025 India Squad Announcement LIVE Updates: BCCI to announce squad on January 18 - Report | Mint - Mint
item.description:
ICC Champions Trophy 2025 India Squad Announcement LIVE Updates

Date: 17 Jan 2025 | Source: Various Reports

India and Pakistan are the last teams to announce their squads for the Champions Trophy, with BCCI postponing the announcement to assess player injuries and the conclusion of the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

  • The squad is expected to be announced on January 18, 2025.
  • Injuries to Jasprit Bumrah and Kuldeep Yadav are causing delays.
  • Hardik Pandya and Rohit Sharma were seen training together.
  • Virat Kohli is dealing with a neck sprain ahead of the tournament.
  • Captain Rohit Sharma's attendance at the captain's meet in Pakistan is uncertain due to political tensions.
  • Harbhajan Singh expressed his preferences for the wicketkeeper role for the squad.
Harbhajan Singh said, "Sanju Samson would be my first choice as wicket keeper for the upcoming Champions Trophy ahead of Rishabh Pant."

This squad announcement is critical as India prepares for one of the most prestigious tournaments in cricket.
